outputs.output_descr: Disaster Risk Reduction and Recovery Team Work plan project

Expected Outcome(s):	Evidence-base for climate risk management strengthened and expanded by assessing climatic risks to key development sectors, DRR-CCA frameworks formulated, institutional and community risk reduction and adaptive capacity built with a view to mainstream climate risk management and promote climate resilience 
Expected Output(s):	i. Convergence and mainstreaming of climate risk management (CRM) promoted. ii. Evidence-base for climate risk management at national and sub-national levels strengthened and expanded. 
iii. Institutional, sectoral and community risk reduction and adaptive capacity developed and knowledge management on CRM issues promoted

DRT will support the development of comprehensive disaster risk reduction programmes in high disaster risk countries. In addition, technical support will be continued to ongoing DRR programmes at the country level. A major thrust of DRT's work plan s to orient all its thematic areas to meet the specific demands emanating from the country offices either through direct support or through partnerships. In partnership with BDP/CDG, DRT will provide support to three COs for DRR capacity assessments and designing capacity development strategies. DRT will also support assessment of recovery capacities in five countries that will form a basis for capacity development in this area.  Technical support will be provided in the area of risk identification to country programmes that include this area of work. The main focus of DRT's mainstreaming work  is to support the application of tools and methodologies developed in previous years to specific country contexts. One major area of support to country programmes will be in the area of climate risk management 
Technical advice will be provided to selected countries on integrating DRR into the CCA/UNDAF.  Further support will be provided to the CCA/UNDAF process through expert roster, capacity development of UNSSC facilitators, UNRC coordination officers and DRR practitioners.
